questions.text: A 32 year old female presented with heavy hairloss since few months. She gives history of suffering with COVID 19 eight month back. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-This is a case of Telogen effluvium,which is a common type of hair loss that affects people after they experience severe stress or a change to their body. Symptoms include thinning hair, usually around the top of your head. Treatment exists to reverse hair loss, but hair will typically grow back in three to six months without treatment. Option B-Female pattern hair loss leads to central balding,but there will be no history of stressor like fever. Option C-Alopecia areata is an autoimmune disease that attacks your body’s hair follicles, causing patchy hair loss.It will be a well circumscribed patch with no erythema or inflammation.Again,there will be no history of stressor like fever. Option D-Trichotillomania is when someone cannot resist the urge to pull out their hair. They may pull out the hair on their head or in other places, such as their eyebrows or eyelashes.It can present with tonsure sign.

questions.text: A farmer having trauma in lower limb following which a cauliflower like growth developed on that site. On HPE Copper penny bodies are seen. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Chromoblastomycosis is a chronic fungal infection of the skin and the subcutaneous tissue caused by traumatic inoculation of a specific group of dematiaceous fungi (usually Fonsecaea pedrosoi, Phialophora verrucosa).The patient presents with cauliflower like growth.On HPE, Copper penny bodies are seen. Option B-Mycetoma is characterised by sinuses,swelling and sulphur granules. Option C-Asteroid bodies are star-shaped inclusions seen in Sporotrichosis. Option D-Phaeohyphomycosis can be caused by many species of dark, melanin-pigmented dematiaceous fungi including Bipolaris, Cladophialophora etc.

questions.text: This appearance is seen in ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Vitamin A deficiency (VAD) can cause a range of ocular mani­festations, known collectively as xerophthalmia, including night blindness, conjunctival and corneal xerosis, and keratomalacia.The given image shows Bitot’s spots,which are typically dry-appearing triangular patches of xerosed conjunctiva with a layer of foam on the surface, usually located temporal to the cornea. Option B-Vitamin B3 deficiency i.e,niacin deficiency can present with casal's necklace. Option C-Vitamin B12 deficiency presents with hyperpigmented knuckles.

questions.text: There is a 0.3 cm ulcerated nodule on nasolabial fold. Diagnosis is ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Basal cell carcinoma can present as a shiny, skin-colored bump that's translucent, meaning you can see a bit through the surface. The bump can look pearly white or pink on white skin.It can also present as ulcerated nodule on nasolabial fold with in a burrowing in appearance known as rodent ulcer. Option B-Most melanomas are brown and black, but they can also be pink, tan, or white. Option C-Squamous cell carcinoma has everted edges. Option D-Kaposi Sarcoma presents as cancerous lesions (spots) on the skin that are purple, red or brown and can appear flat or raised.

questions.text: A patient presented with nail pitting, subungual hyperkeratosis and following nail feature. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given image shows oil drop sign/salmon patch appearance on nail bed which is pathognomonic of psoriasis.Other features of psoriasis are irregular nail pitting, subungual hyperkeratosis and onycholysis. Option B-Lichen planus presents with longitudinal ridging and fissuring, nail plate thinning, and trachyonychia. Option C-Alopecia areata causes regular pitting on nails known as geometric pitting.

questions.text: A female with BMI-30kg/m2 presented with following picture. This is associated with?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Acanthosis nigricans is a condition that causes areas of dark, thick velvety skin in body folds and creases. It typically affects the armpits, groin and neck. Acanthosis nigricans tends to affect people with obesity.hence,it is seen in metabolic syndrome. Option B-Addison’s disease can present with dark hyperpigmented gums and palmar creases. Option C-Hypothyroidism is often associated with vitiligo. Option D-Parathyroid disease can cause metastatic calcification in skin.

questions.text: A Patient presented with borderline leprosy of the face.which nerve is affected?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The most common cranial nerve affected in leprosy is facial nerve>trigeminal nerve. Hence,CN7 is a better answer than CN5.

questions.text: A truck driver comes with complaints of painless, indurated genital ulcer after unprotected/unsafe intercourse. The motility of the causative agent can be detected by which type of microscope
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given case scenario of painless, indurated genital ulcer after unprotected/unsafe intercourse suggests the diagnosis of syphilis.The motility of the causative agent i.e,treponema pallidum can be detected by Dark field microscope. Option B,C-Electron and Flourescent microscopes cannot show motility.

questions.text: A patient presented with finger with paronychia & extensive linear wheal like pattern on upper limb. Antibiotic for treatment?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given case scenario of finger with paronychia & extensive linear wheal like pattern on upper limb suggests the diagnosis of cellulitis.The most common organism is staphylococcus aureus.Amoxiclav is the drug of choice in cellulitis. Option B,C,D-Norfloxacin,Amikacin and Metronidazole are not the first line for cellulitis.

questions.text: A migrant labourer presented with burning micturition and urethral discharge within one week of unprotected sexual intercourse. What is the causative agent?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,C,D-E.coli,Ureaplasma and Trichomonas are less common causes of urethritis following sexual intercourse and the incubation period is usually more than 1 week. Option B-since patient presented with burning micturition and urethral discharge,it indicates diagnosis of urethritis.And since the patient was symptomatic within one week of unprotected sexual intercourse.The causative agent will be neisseria gonorrhea.

questions.text: A married female infertile for 4 years want to conceive complaints of profuse non-foul smelling, non itchy white discharge for 2 days. Her last menstrual period was 13-14 days back. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Candidiasis is a vaginal yeast infection which may cause intense itching of the vagina and vulva, and women often have a thick, white, curd-like discharge. Option B-Physiological discharge is profuse, non-foul smelling, non itchy and white in colour and it especially occurs around the day of ovulation i.e. 14th day of menstrual cycle. Option C-Bacterial vaginosis shows profuse,off white discharge with foul smell. Option D-Trichomoniasis shows greenish frothy discharge.

questions.text: A 30 year old patient comes with flaccid bullae on the skin which is easy to rupture. Biopsy revealed suprabasal split. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Pemphigus vulgaris patient comes with flaccid bullae on the skin which is easy to rupture due to Anti desmoglein 3.In such patients,suprabasal split will be seen on Biopsy. Option B-Pemphigus foliaceous patient also comes with flaccid bullae on the skin which is easy to rupture due to Anti desmoglein 1.In such patients,subcorneal split will be seen on Biopsy. Option C-Pemphigus vegetans will show cauliflower like mass in flexures like axilla. Option D-Erythema Multiforme shows multiple target lesions on palms and soles.

questions.text: A patient who is a farmer works in maize field and have more maize in his food presented with diarrhoea, dementia and some lesions on neck, which vitamin deficiency can lead to the given condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Niacin deficiency presents with diarrhoea, dementia and dermatitis in form of casal's necklace around neck. Option B-Riboflavin deficiency presents with cheilitis,glossitis and angular stomatitis. Option C-Pyridoxine deficiency presents with peripheral neuropathy. Option D-Tyrosine deficiency cannot lead to niacin deficiency.Tryptophan deficiency can lead to niacin deficiency.

questions.text: A girl child presented with rough keratotic lesions over her elbow, knee and she also had problem in dark vision/night vision. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Phrynoderma is a form of asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic follicular hyperkeratosis, where follicular papules of various sizes are found on the back of the elbows and the front of the knees, and can spread to involve the extremities, upper forearms and thighs.This is seen in cases of vitamin A deficieny,essential fatty acid deficiency and malnutrition. Option B-KP(keratosis pilaris) is a harmless skin condition that causes dry, rough patches and tiny bumps, often on the upper arms, thighs, cheeks or buttocks. The bumps usually don't hurt or itch. Option C-Darier disease, previously known as keratosis follicularis, is a genodermatosis inherited in an autosomal dominant fashion.This rare disease classically features multiple red or brown papules with hyperkeratosis and nail abnormalities (eg, longitudinal erythronychia). Option D-Folliculitis is a common skin condition that happens when hair follicles become inflamed. It's often caused by an infection with bacteria. At first it may look like small pimples around the hair follicles.The condition can be itchy and sore.

questions.text: A male child presented with swelling in the scalp for 3 months. He has a dog in the home. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Folliculitis is a common skin condition that happens when hair follicles become inflamed. It's often caused by an infection with bacteria. At first it may look like small pimples around hair follicles.The condition can be itchy and sore. Option B-A skin abscess is a bump within or below the skin’s surface. It is usually full of pus, painful, and may feel thick and swollen. This is typically caused by a bacterial infection. Option C-Epidermoid cysts are harmless small bumps beneath the skin. They are most common on the face, neck and trunk.Epidermoid cysts are slow growing and often painless, so they rarely cause problems or need treatment. Option D-A kerion is an inflammatory, pus-filled sore (abscess) that sometimes oozes. Kerions form when our immune system overreacts to the fungal infection ringworm (tinea corporis). They most often appear on your scalp, but they may also appear on your face, neck, shoulders and upper arms.The history of dog in the home also suggests diagnosis of fungal infection.

choices.text: She is susceptible to chicken pox

questions.text: A 23 year female, primi gravida, whose nephew is staying in the same house, contracted varicella. Patient had no history of past exposure. She visited medical care centre where the varicella antibody test done and found negative?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Since patient had no history of past exposure and also the varicella antibody test was found negative,so patient can get varicella. since this will be the 1st episode of varicella,hence,patient will have chickenpox. hence,the patient is susceptible to chickenpox. after the 1st episode of chickenpox,the virus can undergo re-activation and can result in herpes zoster infection.

questions.text: A patient with the ringworm infection of the scalp. On wood’s lamp examination, dermatophytic infection was suspected. Hair perforation test was positive. diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Since the patient has ringworm infection of the scalp and On wood’s lamp examination, dermatophytic infection was suspected.Hair perforation test is done to differentiate between T.mentagrophyte and T. Rubrum.Hair perforation test is positive in cases of T.mentagrophyte. Option B,C-Microsporum gypseum and Microsporum audounii can also causes tinea capitis but hair perforation test is negative in them. Option D-Epidermophyton floccosum do not affect hairs.

questions.text: Patient on multidrug therapy for leprosy presented with inflammation of the existing lesions, nerve involvement is also seen without systemic features. What will be the treatment approach?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Since patient is on treatment of leprosy and after starting treatment, there is sudden inflammation, that means it is a lepra reaction. Also patient presented with inflammation of the existing lesions and nerve involvement is also seen without systemic features.That indicates it's lepra reaction type 1. For both lepra reaction (type I & II) ,the DOC is steroids. In case of any lepra reaction,The MDT should be continued and it should not be stopped. Thalidomide is given in resistant cases of type 2 lepra reaction.

questions.text: Which of the following is used as nail lacquer for fungal infections?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-oral fluconazole is effective in candidal infections. Option B-topical Nystatin is applied for oral thrush. Option C-Terbinafine is given orally for onychomycosis. Option D-For Nail fungus ,different formulation of antifungals Nail lacquer are available like Ciclopirox olamine and Amorolfine.

questions.text: Identify the phenomenon shown in the image:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The Koebner phenomenon is the appearance of new skin lesions on previously unaffected skin secondary to trauma.This phenomenon is also termed the isomorphic response, given that the new lesions appear clinically and histologically identical to the patient’s underlying cutaneous disease.In other words, a patient with psoriasis who exhibits koebnerization (and is said to be “Koebner-positive”) develops new psoriasiform lesions along sites of skin injury, even if trivial. Option B-The reverse Koebner phenomenon is the disappearance of a skin lesion after trauma to the area. Option C-Gottron papules are symmetric changes over the extensor surfaces of joints, being characterised with erythematous and scaly plaques,seen in dermatomyositis. Option D-Nikolsky sign is demonstrated when lateral pressure is applied on the border of an intact blister, which results in the dislodgment of the normal epidermis and extension of the blister.

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given image depicts DLE,which is characterised by persistent scaly plaques on the scalp, face, and ears which subsequently can progress to scarring and atrophy. Option B-SLE can present with malar rash with sparing of nasolabial folds. Option C-Rosacea is common and is characterised by persistent facial redness. It typically has a relapsing and remitting course, with symptoms controlled by lifestyle measures, general skin care, medications, and procedural interventions. Option D-Vitiligo presents with a hypopigmented patch.

questions.text: Identify the condition
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Granuloma annulare is a skin condition that causes a raised rash or bumps in a ring pattern, usually on the hands and feet. Option B-In this case,we can see an annual plaque is present wioth central clearing.If Annular plaque is present and : - Central atrophy - Lupus Vulgaris Central clearing - Tinea /dermatophtic infections Central crusting - Cutaneous Leishmaniasis Option C-Pyoderma gangrenosum is a rare condition that causes large, painful sores on the skin,which can later ulcerate. The sores can develop quickly. Most often they appear on the legs. The exact causes of pyoderma gangrenosum are unknown, but it appears to be a disorder of the immune system. Option D-Ichthyosis vulgaris is an inherited or acquired skin condition that occurs when the skin doesn’t shed its dead skin cells.This causes dry, dead skin cells to accumulate in patches on the surface of the skin. It’s also known as “fish scale disease” because the dead skin accumulates in a similar pattern to a fish’s scales.

questions.text: A 25 year old male presents with grouped vesicles over lips as shown in image. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Impetigo is a common skin infection that most often affects young children. Bacteria including Staphylococcus aureus and Group A streptococcus cause the infection, which can lead to itchy sores and blisters,which can lead to honey colored crust. Treatment includes antibiotics. Option B-Pemphigus vulgaris presents with a flaccid blister. Option C-Varicella zoster occurs along a dermatomal distribution due to reactivation of virus. Option D-Herpes labialis presents with grouped vesicles over lips as shown in image,mostly due to HSV-1.

questions.text: One-year-old child presents with eczematous dermatitis over face (Image shown). His mother has the history of bronchial asthma. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Infantile eczematous dermatitis do not have family history of atopy. Option B-Seborrheic dermatitis (SD) is a common inflammatory skin disease presenting with a papulosquamous morphology in areas rich in sebaceous glands, particularly the scalp, face, and body folds. Option C-Air borne contact dermatitis occur due to parthenium pollens but there will be no history of atopy. Option D-Atopic dermatitis is a long-term (chronic) skin condition. It causes dry, itchy skin. It’s a very common condition in babies and children. It usually first appears between ages 3 and 6 months.In babies, symptoms usually affect the face, neck, scalp, elbows, and knees.Also,His mother has the history of bronchial asthma,which supports diagnosis of Atopic dermatitis.

questions.text: A patient presented to the OPD with complaints of papular lesions over the extremities. On examination the lesions were soft and non-tender. Image of the lesion is provided below. What is the probable diagnosis of this case?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Condylomata lata are hypopigmented, gray or white moist plaques located in the genital area in patients of syphilis. Option B-Molluscum contagiosum is a viral skin infection that causes one or many raised, pearl-like bumps (papules) with an umbilicated center. Option C-Condyloma acuminata is a manifestation of human papillomavirus (HPV) infection. The condition is characterized by skin-colored, fleshy papules in the anogenital region. Option D-Common warts are papular lesions over the extremities.The lesions are soft and non-tender,as shown in image.They are caused by HPV.

questions.text: Identify the disorder depicted in the image below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Vitiligo causes your skin to lose color or pigmentation. Smooth white or light areas called macules or patches appear on your skin. It generally starts on your hands, forearms, feet and face.But there will be no history of application of any chemical. Option B-Piebaldism refers to the absence of mature melanin-forming cells (melanocytes) in certain areas of the skin and hair.Common characteristics include a congenital white forelock, scattered normal pigmented and hypopigmented macules and a triangular shaped depigmented patch on the forehead. Option C-Albinism is a rare genetic condition caused by mutations, or changes, of certain genes that affect the amount of melanin your body produces. Melanin controls the pigmentation (color) of your skin, eyes and hair. People with albinism have extremely pale skin, eyes and hair. Option D-In bindi, there is an adhesive known as PTBP (Paratertiary butyl phenol). This chemical results in localised depigmentation of region, known as contact leukoderma.

questions.text: Velvety hyperpigmentation on flexural area of individual suffering from diabetes as shown in the Image. Identify the lesion?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-A Becker naevus is a late-onset epidermal nevus characterised by a large brown patch with hairs on shoulder region. Option B-Acanthosis nigricans is a condition that causes areas of dark, thick velvety skin in body folds and creases. It typically affects the armpits, groin and neck. Acanthosis nigricans tends to affect people with obesity. Option C- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches. Option D-Erythrasma is a skin condition caused by the normal skin bacteria Corynebacterium minutissimum.Erythrasma presents as well-defined pink or brown patches

questions.text: A patient presented with multiple painful blisters on an erythematous base along dermatome on trunk as shown in the image. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Herpes simplex virus can cause blisters on lips or around mouth or genitals but it don't occur in a dermatomal distribution. Option B-Shingles/Herpes zoster presents as a grouped vesicle along a dermatome as shown in figure. Option C-The diagnosis of molluscum contagiosum is based on clinical examination. Lesions are firm, white to flesh-colored, dome-shaped, pearly papules, having a central umbilication. Option D-Chickenpox is an illness caused by the varicella-zoster virus. It brings on an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters.

questions.text: Identify the arthropod shown in image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Body and head lice (Pediculus humanus humanus and P. h. capitis, respectively) cause a condition in humans known as Pediculosis. Although body lice are usually found on the torso, and head lice are found on the head and face, both species may change location. Option B-Sarcoptes scabiei var hominis is the causative agent of scabies as shown in figure.Adult scabies mites are spherical, eyeless mites with four pairs of legs (two pairs in front and two pairs behind). Option C-Phthirus pubis causes pediculosis pubis and has claws. Option D-Dermatobia hominis looks like a fly.

questions.text: Tzanck smear is used to diagnose all except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-The diagnosis of herpes simplex virus may require virological confirmation. Tzanck smear is an old, rapid, cost effective but nonspecific method that has been recently re-evaluated as a method for the diagnosis of herpes virus infection.Materials obtained from a fresh vesicle were used to prepare Tzanck smears.HSV-1,HSV-2 and HHV-3,all show multinucleated giant cells on tzanck smear. Option D-Tzanck smear is not used to diagnose HIV.

questions.text: Only dimorphic fungus which is also a subcutaneous mycosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Dimorphic fungi are : -Histoplasmosis -Sporotrichosis -Coccidioidomycosis -Paracoccidiomycosis -Blastomycosis -Talaromycosis Only dimporphic fungus which causes subcutaneous Mycosis is Sporotrichosis

questions.text: A adult male with multiple sexual partners comes with history of painless genital ulcer. What is the next Investigation of choice?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Treponema pallidum are not seen on Gram stain. Option B-This is a case of Syphilitic ulcers which are : - Single - Clean - Non - tender -Does not bleed on touch - Indurated (hard) Syphilitic ulcers are also called hard Chancre/ hunterian Chancre. The next Investigation of choice for syphilitic ulcer is dark field microscopy. Option C-HSV 2 Ab will be used to diagnose HSV,which is characterised by vesicular lesions. Option D-Treponema pallidum are not properly seen on Giemsa stain.

questions.text: A patient with silvery micaceous scales as shown, diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Scales in Psoriasis are Micaceous and silvery white,seen on Sites such as Extensors. Option B-lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches. Option C-Atopic dermatitis (eczema) is a condition that causes dry, itchy and inflamed skin. Option D-Pityriasis versicolor is a common yeast infection of the skin, in which flaky discoloured patches appear on the chest and back.

questions.text: A female presented to the hospital with complaints of frothy discharge. Wet mount showed Trophozoite moving around. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Bacterial vaginosis is characterised by foul smelling off white discharge. Option B-Trichomoniasis has a frothy green foul smelling discharge. Option C-Candidiasis gives curdy white discharge. Option D-Physiological discharge is non foul smelling and non itching,peaking during ovulation.

questions.text: Identify the lesion?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Grading of acne vulgaris: Grade 1 : Comedones predominant. Open Comedones - Black in colour, Atmospheric air comes inside the hair follicle and oxidises the sebum. So they are black in colour. Closed comedones - white in colour Grade 2 : Papules predominant Grade 3 : Pustules predominant Grade 4 : Nodulocystic Acne ( Most severe type)

questions.text: A Patient with white lacy mucosal lesions and following skin lesions, diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Psoriasis has silvery micaceous scales. Option B-Eczema is characterised by chronic itching and oozing. Option C- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches. Option D-Tinea is a fungal infection,characterised by annular patches.

questions.text: A truck driver with history of genital ulcers and following skin lesion. What can be the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-In the image, we can see lot of cutaneous lesions on the palmar and plantar surface.This is seen in secondary syphilis. Option B- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches. Option C-Hand foot and mouth disease has vesicular lesions on palms and soles. Option D-'Keratoderma' is a term that means marked thickening of the epidermis of the skin.

questions.text: Melanin is formed from?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Melanin, the pigment responsible for skin, hair, and eye color, is primarily formed from the amino acid tyrosine. This complex biochemical process, known as melanogenesis, occurs within specialized cells called melanocytes. The initial and rate-limiting step in melanin synthesis is the hydroxylation of tyrosine to 3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (DOPA), and then the oxidation of DOPA to dopaquinone. Both these steps are catalyzed by the enzyme tyrosinase. Subsequent reactions, involving various intermediates, lead to the formation of different types of melanin, primarily eumelanin (black/brown pigment) and pheomelanin (red/yellow pigment). Therefore, tyrosine is the fundamental precursor for all melanin production. Why other options are incorrect: B. Tryptophan: Tryptophan is an essential amino acid and a precursor for several important biomolecules, including serotonin, melatonin, and niacin (Vitamin B3). However, it is not involved in the synthesis of melanin. C. Leucine: Leucine is an essential branched-chain amino acid (BCAA) crucial for protein synthesis, muscle repair, and energy production. It plays no role in melanin formation. D. Valine: Valine is also an essential branched-chain amino acid involved in muscle metabolism and tissue repair. Like leucine, it is not a precursor for melanin.

questions.text: A patient presented with multiple painful blisters along a dermatome on the trunk as shown in the image. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Herpes zoster/Shingles has multiple painful blisters along a dermatome due to reactivation of virus. Option B-HSV can cause vesicular lesions on genital organs. Option C-Molluscum contagiosum has dome shaped papules with umbilication. Option D-Chicken pox has vesicular lesions in multiple stages of development.

questions.text: Koebner’s phenomenon is seen in all except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-The Koebner phenomenon (KP) is the appearance of new skin lesions on previously unaffected skin secondary to trauma.This phenomenon is also termed the isomorphic response, given that the new lesions appear clinically and histologically identical to the patient’s underlying cutaneous disease.True koebner phenomena is seen in psoriasis,lichen planus and vitiligo. Option D-Herpes simplex causes pseudo koebnerization,which is the appearance of new skin lesions on previously unaffected skin secondary to viral inoculation at new site.

questions.text: A patient presented with following lesions on the trunk, diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Erythrodermic psoriasis has diffuse redness of skin. Option B-Pustular psoriasis produces lakes of pus on skin. Option C-Inverse psoriasis is seen in flexure areas. Option D-Guttate psoriasis has rain drop lesions, seen in Children, on Trunk >> extremities .There is a Preceeding h/o sore throat and the treatment is antibiotics.

questions.text: Neurofibromatosis type 1 is a hereditary condition associated with café-au-lait spots on the skin. Which pattern of inheritance is seen in this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Neurofibromatosis type 1 is a hereditary condition,Autosomal dominant in nature.The gene affected is NF-1,located on chromosome 17. The clinical features are lisch nodules on iris,neurofibromas on skin,cafe au lait spots,axillary frecklings and optic gliomas.

questions.text: A 26 year old female presented with scaly skin. On histopathology neutrophils were present. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Pemphigus Foliaceous causes subcorneal split. Option B-Pemphigus vulgaris causes suprabasal split,resulting in row of tombstone appearanace. Option C-Neutrophilic collection in epidermis is k/s munro microabscess and kogoj spongiform pustule, which is seen in Psoriasis.

questions.text: A patient came to OPD with complaints of Diarrhoea, dermatitis and mental retardation. It was found that he was a maize eater. Which of the following could be the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Beri-beri causes peripheral neuropathy. Option B-Pellagra presents with Diarrhoea, dermatitis and mental retardation,which occurs due to niacin deficiency,which occurs in maize eaters. Option C-Night blindness occurs due to vitamin A deficiency. Option D-kwashiorkor occurs due to protein energy malnutrition.

questions.text: All are seen in this condition except?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Munro microabscess/kogoj pustules are neutrophilic collections in epidermis seen in psoriasis. Option B,C,D- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches.Wickham striae,Saw tooth acanthosis and Civatte bodies/shiny plaques are characteristic features of lichen planus.

questions.text: Patient is on treatment with 13-cis retinoic acid. Which of the following is one of the side effect of the drug?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Isotretinoin also known as 13-cis retinoic acid is used in acne.The side effects are:- 1. Dryness 2. Altered LFT and TAG levels 3. Pseudotumor cerebri 4. DISH (diffuse idiopathic skeleton hyperostosis) and teratogenicity like microtia/anotia. Hence,isotretinoin is avoided in pregnancy due to risk of teratogenicity.

questions.text: A 25 year old female came with chief complaints of vaginal discharge with lower abdominal pain and tenderness. Which color kit you will prescribe to her?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The chief complaints of vaginal discharge with lower abdominal pain and tenderness indicates diagnosis of PID.Kit no.6 (yellow) is given for PID.

questions.text: Identify the plant shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Parthenium hysterophorus is the commonest cause of airborne contact dermatitis (ABCD) in India. It has white flowers and it's pollen is responsible for ABCD.The disease usually manifests as itchy erythematous, papular, papulovesicular and plaque lesions on exposed areas of the body.

questions.text: A patient presented with hypopigmented macules over back and upper trunk. On KOH mount spaghetti and meat ball appearance was seen. What can be the causative agent?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-The given scenario is of hypopigmented macules over back and upper trunk.Spaghetti & meat ball appearance is seen on KOH mount in cases of Pityriasis versicolor,which occurs secondary to malassezia furfur.Under the wood’s lamp, it appears yellow. Option B-Tinea nigra infections can present with multiple macules that can be mottled or velvety in appearance, and may be oval or irregular in shape. Option C- Trichosporum may cause superficial infections, such as white piedra and onychomycosis. Option D-Candida can cause oral thrush.

questions.text: Patient present with lesions as shown in the image, later patient also developed arthritis. What is the treatment?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-This is a case of psoriasis.In Psoriatic arthritis,the DOC is Methotrexate. Option B,C,D-Cyclophosphamide,Mycophenolate mofetil and Rituximab are used in resistant cases.

questions.text: A female student presents with urticaria following intake of sea food. She wants a non sedating drug since this is her exam time. Which is the preferred antihistamine for this patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A,B,C-Chlorpheniramine,Promethazine and Diphenhydramine are sedative as they are 1st generation antihistaminics. Option D-This patient with urticaria wants a non-sedating antihistamine. And since 1st generation of anti-histaminics offer more sedation than the 2nd so we will prefer 2nd generation here i.e. fexofenadine.

questions.text: What could be the diagnosis for this Image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Alopecia areata presents as a well demarcated patch of hair loss without erythema or scaling. Option B-Telogen effluvium has history of preceding fever and hair density on scalp remains same in case of acute telogen effluvium. Option C-Trichotillomania is a hair pulling disorder,which can present with tonsure sign. Option D-Anagen effluvium can result from cancer chemotherapy.

questions.text: A patient who is a farmer/gardener by occupation, presented with the following lesion.diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Mycetoma is characterised by triad of swelling,sinuses and sulphur granules. Option B-Chromoblastomycosis presents with cauliflower like warty lesions. Option C-Sporotrichosis spreads along lymphatics. Option D-Phaeohyphomycosis can be caused by many species of dark, melanin-pigmented dematiaceous fungi including Bipolaris, Cladophialophora etc.

questions.text: A 70 year old patient develop the following lesion over face since 2 years. Diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Basal cell carcinoma presents with nodular lesion over tha face with beaded rolled out margins. Option B-Squamous cell carcinoma can cause everted margins. Option C-Malignant melanoma can cause variegated appearance with irregular borders. Option D-keratoacanthoma is a fast-growing, dome-shaped skin tumor that usually occurs on sun-exposed areas of the body, especially the head, neck, arms, legs, and back of the hands. Keratoacanthomas often begin in a hair follicle.

questions.text: A young lady presents with lacy lesions in oral cavity and her proximal nail fold has extended onto the nail bed. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Psoriasis presents with silvery micaceous scales. Option B-Geographic tongue is seen in cases of vitamin deficiencies. Option C- lichen planus often appears as purple, itchy, flat bumps that develop over several weeks. In the mouth and genital mucosa, lichen planus forms lacy white patches.The proximal nail fold can extend onto the nail bed known as dorsal pterygium. Option D-Candidiasis presents with white lesions in mouth that can be scraped off.

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Condyloma acuminata is a manifestation of human papillomavirus (HPV) infection. The condition is characterized by skin-colored, fleshy papules in the anogenital region. Option B-Bowen disease is carcinoma in situ on penis. Option C-Condylomata lata refers to a benign and painless cutaneous manifestation of syphilis They are hypopigmented, gray or white moist plaques located in the genital area, inner thighs, axillae, or within the oral mucosa. Option D-Hemorrhoids looks reddish to bluish in colour,protruding from anal canal.

questions.text: A patient presented with the following lesion. Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Hypomelanosis of Ito is a rare condition characterized by distinctive skin changes, in which areas of the body lack skin color (hypopigmentation) especially in shoulder region. Option B-Vitiligo (segmental) is depigmentation along a dermatome,that do not cross midline. Option C-Nevus of ito is another name for Hypomelanosis of ito. Option D-Becker’s nevus is hyperpigmented with hairs on it.

questions.text: A lady developed a skin reaction as shown in the image after using a hair dye. Which of the following chemicals is responsible for this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) This is most likely a case of hypersensitivity reaction caused by p-phenylenediamine (PPD), which is present in hair dyes. Hair dyes such as PPD have the potential to cause contact dermatitis. A patch test is recommended 24-48 hours before its usage either on the forearm or behind the ear. The appearance of any redness, blistering or swelling implies allergy.

questions.text: A female patient presented with acne that is not resolving on oral isotretinoin and antibiotics therapy. Which of the following is the next best investigation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A,C,D-dietary triggers,antibiotic resistance and drug triggers are other factors that may result in non-responsiveness. Option B-The next best step for a female patient with acne that is resistant to oral isotretinoin is to check for hyperandrogenism. Hyperandrogenism usually manifests as hirsutism, acne, and/or androgenetic alopecia. Acne that is persistent, moderate to severe, or late onset raises concern for PCOS or other causes of hyperandrogenism.

questions.text: Which of the following is associated with the clinical condition shown in the image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) This is a case of Congenital melanocytic nevi (CMN) which are benign, pigmented melanocytic nevi present at birth. They are most commonly brown, black, purplish or red, usually a palpable lesion with heterogeneous color and texture.Malignant melanoma is more commonly associated with a congenital melanocytic nevus.

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient with hair loss that follows a particular pattern as shown in the image, a history of flat lesions near the anal canal, rashes on the body. What is causative agent?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Explanation: The patient presents with a combination of symptoms: hair loss in a particular pattern (moth-eaten alopecia, which is visible in the image), flat lesions near the anal canal (condylomata lata), and rashes on the body. This constellation of symptoms is highly suggestive of secondary syphilis, a systemic infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum (A). Moth-eaten alopecia is a characteristic, albeit uncommon, manifestation of secondary syphilis, resulting from patchy hair loss. Condylomata lata are moist, broad-based, raised papules that are highly infectious and typically found in anogenital or intertriginous areas in secondary syphilis. Generalized rashes, often maculopapular and non-itchy, are also common in this stage. Let's look at why the other options are incorrect: B. Microsporum: Microsporum is a genus of fungi that causes dermatophytosis, specifically tinea capitis (ringworm of the scalp). While it causes hair loss, it typically results in well-demarcated patches of alopecia with scaling and broken hairs, and it does not cause the widespread flat lesions or body rashes described, nor condylomata lata. C. Sporothrix: Sporothrix is a dimorphic fungus that causes sporotrichosis, primarily affecting the skin (cutaneous sporotrichosis), usually presenting as nodular lesions that may ulcerate and spread along lymphatic channels. It is not typically associated with the type of hair loss or generalized rashes described, nor with condylomata lata. D. Malassezia: Malassezia is a genus of yeast that is part of the normal skin flora but can cause various skin conditions, including seborrheic dermatitis, tinea versicolor, and folliculitis. While seborrheic dermatitis can cause scalp flaking and some hair thinning, it does not cause the characteristic "moth-eaten" alopecia or the flat anal lesions and body rashes seen in secondary syphilis.

questions.text: A Young patient complains of painful vesicular rash near this genital area. Identify the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Herpes infection

questions.text: Identify the marked structure shown in the diagram?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 35 year old patient with a hypopigmented anesthetic patch with nerve thickening and intradermal antigen test. The histopathology is shown below, pick one correct statement regarding the condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: The drug to be given in a 25-year-old male patient with papular acne as shown in the image is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) For the 25-year-old male patient presenting with papular acne on his back, as shown in the image, Systemic Doxycycline (Option B) is generally the most appropriate drug. Papular acne, which indicates inflammatory lesions (red, raised bumps), especially when widespread on the back, often requires a systemic approach for effective management. Doxycycline, a tetracycline antibiotic, is highly effective in treating moderate to severe inflammatory acne due to its dual action: it reduces the population of Cutibacterium acnes (formerly Propionibacterium acnes), a bacterium contributing to acne inflammation, and it possesses significant anti-inflammatory properties. Its systemic delivery ensures that the medication reaches all affected areas, making it a practical and efficacious choice for widespread truncal acne where topical application can be difficult and less effective. Topical Dapsone (Option A) is less likely to be the primary answer. While topical dapsone is an anti-inflammatory agent used for inflammatory acne, particularly in certain patient populations, its efficacy for widespread or more significant papular acne on the back is generally not as robust as systemic treatments. Topical medications can also be cumbersome to apply consistently to large areas like the back. Systemic Minocycline (Option C) is also a systemic tetracycline antibiotic, similar to doxycycline, and is indeed a highly effective treatment for moderate to severe inflammatory acne. Both doxycycline and minocycline are common first-line systemic antibiotics for this type of acne. In a multiple-choice scenario where only one "best" answer can be selected without further differentiating factors (e.g., patient allergies, specific side effect profiles), both B and C are strong candidates. However, often only one is presented as the intended best choice in such questions, and doxycycline is very frequently prescribed. Systemic Isotretinoin (Option D) is a potent oral retinoid reserved for severe forms of acne, such as nodulocystic acne, acne that is recalcitrant to other treatments, or acne causing significant scarring or psychological distress. While highly effective and capable of inducing long-term remission, it has a significant side effect profile and requires strict monitoring. The image, while showing papular acne, does not necessarily depict the severity typically warranting isotretinoin as an initial treatment; it's generally considered after less aggressive systemic options like antibiotics have failed or if the acne is clearly severe from the outset.

questions.text: A hair shaft with fungal conidia is seen in the image below. Identify the fungi associated with it
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A patient presents with a plaque on face with central clearing and atrophy as shown. Chest X ray reveals apical calcification. What is the next steps to confirm?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) This is patient of Lupus vulgaris (classical plaque with central atrophy and active periphery). To confirm diagnosis, we do skin biopsy. But this is not in the option and hence the next best option to confirm the diagnosis is PCR

questions.text: A women presents with pruritic rash on the elbows, buttocks with recent diagnosis of gluten sensitive enteropathy. On immunofluorescence IgA deposition is seen as shown in the image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) A patient with pruritic rash on the elbows, buttocks with recent diagnosis of gluten sensitive enteropathy. On immunofluorescence IgA deposition on the tip of dermal papilla, this is classical of dermatitis herpetiformis

questions.text: A hypopigmented patch on the trunk since birth, which is chawky to dull white on wood’s lamp. Diascopy is inconclusive. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Correct Answer – Nevus depigmentosus Clinical clues:Hypopigmented patch present since birth ? suggests a congenital lesion Chalky to dull white under Wood’s lamp ? indicates partial pigment loss, not complete depigmentation Diascopy inconclusive ? no significant vascular involvement or blanching Nevus depigmentosus:A stable, congenital hypopigmented maculeShows dull white fluorescence (unlike vitiligo which is sharply chalk-white) no progression or spread with age Wood’s lamp: hypopigmentation (not depigmentation)Histology: normal melanocyte number, but decreased melanin production

questions.text: A patient presents with irregular swelling over the foot, multiple discharging sinuses and black granules. A KOH mount is performed on the discharge. What is the most likely observation
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The triad of swelling, discharging sinuses, black grain is very classical of Eumycetoma, which is due to fungus ad hence on KOH we will see septate hyphae

questions.text: A patient presents with oral lesions with symptoms worsen on eating spicy food. Which is the trigger factor?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This is a patient of oral lichen planus. the triggers of LP is beta blocker>lithium

questions.text: A patient presents with history of freckles, marked photosensitivity, and 2 basal cell carcinoma lesions aggravated by sun exposure. Which DNA repair pathway is most likely defective in this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) This is a patient of xenoderma pigmentosum (freckle on face, photosensitivity, skin cancer), which is due to Nucloetide excision repair defect.

questions.text: A patient presented with following features, what will you do next?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) This is the image of Phrynoderma which is due to vitamin A deficiency. The next we do in this patient is ocular examination as in these patient we can get xerophthalmia
